posts.post_content:
Anybody with extras?  I especially need Lennox, McElveen, Moriarty, and Mullin.  Let me know what you have!

Cheers,
Geno
I have Pfiester at SGC right now.
Mine's a PSA 5, so I would be interested if yours came back better.  Let me know!

Sure it won't come back that nice.  A 5 is a nice card, congrats.  It will probably come back as a SGC 20 or 30.  Taking maybe 7 or 8 cards as trade bait to the National.  Maybe get some action for some Low grade T205 Cubs from my card list.

I'm with you, Ken!  The reason I started collecting the Sovereign backs was because after completing the whole set, I wanted to do it again.  But I didn't want  to buy Cobb, and the Sovereigns have most of the Cubs!  Hence, the start of my Sovereign collection!  I've been addicted to the Cubs since the outfield was patrolled by Cardenal, Monday, and Morales.  Steve Swisher was a god to a Little League catcher.  I also played SS, but that that Mick Kelleher, Davey Rosello platoon was hard to swallow.

Take Care,
Geno

[quote name="HercDriver" post=1675594]I'm with you, Ken!  The reason I started collecting the Sovereign backs was because after completing the whole set, I wanted to do it again.  But I didn't want  to buy Cobb, and the Sovereigns have most of the Cubs!  Hence, the start of my Sovereign collection!  I've been addicted to the Cubs since the outfield was patrolled by Cardenal, Monday, and Morales.  Steve Swisher was a god to a Little League catcher. Been a cub fan my whole life.  Know many of the retired Cubs from my 5 years of Cubs camp including Cardenal.  Jose is funny and has some great stories.  He is also good friends with Eddie Vedder of pearl Jam fame.  I have all the Sovereign Cubs except Archer.  There are 152 possible card front back combos for T205 Cubs of which I have 137 so looking for 15 cards.  Also looking for T 207 Napoleon backed Cubs.  Have my work cut out for me.

Best in cardboard,

Ken
